text:
Kind of. using the CLI you can create HubDB tables based on a local JSON file. This is handy for say copying a HubDB over to a different account.

This does not make it so you could just place this json file inside the theme, and at install(if it were a marketplace theme) itâ€™d just create the table automatically. You would need to run the command.

<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/developer-reference/local-development-cli#hubdb-commands>
<@UN7CEHC9X> <@UQWGKUEN7> Happy to share, especially if you have any specific questions. I mostly followed the HubSpot guide to Github Actions and made very few modifications

<@UDHT6N5SM> Thank you for the willingness to share. Did you follow this guide <https://github.com/marketplace/actions/HubSpot-cms-deploy> ? Have you added a some kind of theme validation before deploying it to a portal?
